sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Reasons academie. Set foorth by Robert Mason of Lincolnes Inne, Gent Mason, Robert, 1571-1635. Davies, John, Sir, 1569-1626.
[8], 104, [8] p., folded table
Imprinted by Th. Creede, for Iohn Browne, and are to be solde at his shop in S. Dunstons Church-yard in Fleet-streete, London : 1605.
Formerly attributed to Sir John Davies, who apparently wrote the poem "Reasons moane" at end. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. In this state "To the reader" occupies A4 only; B1r line 1 of text ends: to dis-. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
Reasons academie. Set foorth by Robert Mason of Lincolnes Inne, Gent Mason, Robert, 1571-1635. Davies, John, Sir, 1569-1626.
[8], 104, [8] p., folded table
Imprinted by Th. Creede, for Iohn Browne, and are to be solde at his shop in S. Dunstons Church-yard in Fleet-streete, London : 1605.
Formerly attributed to Sir John Davies, who apparently wrote the poem "Reasons moane" at end. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. In this state "To the reader" occupies A4 only; B1r line 1 of text ends: to dis-. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Iohn Browne
Th. Creede
his shop in S. Dunstons Church-yard in Fleet-streete
>>>>>>> imprintparse
